body.name: The Husband List (The Worthington Brides Book 2)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #22,663 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #275 in Women's Historical Fiction #453 in Regency Historical Romance #487 in Regency Romances

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong and reliable, this author always delivers.
reviews.reviewText: Ella Quinn delivers another solid historical romance. I became engrossed with the characters straight off.But my favorite aspect of this novel was (the HG-TV parts) where Madeline renovates, decorates, and furnishes her new home from scratch. I can't recall an author ever incorporating this into one of their stories and I thoroughly enjoyed it.I realize this is a small snippet of the story, but it was so unique.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice historical romance
reviews.reviewText: Very nice but somewhat predictable, as it follows the pattern of most books in this series. The love and support of a large family, the importance and care of children, respect for women, the helping the disadvantaged, and all the trappings of the aristocracy in the early 1800s.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finding the Right Husband
reviews.reviewText: What a lovely, enjoyable romance! I loved both the hero and heroine because they are such honorable people. I really enjoyed the other characters from the previous novel joining in the fun. I appreciate a calm, meandering story about their courtship and marriage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Sweet romance. Madeline and Henry meet and fall for one another but Madeline's mother has been insistent that she marry someone titled, which Henry is not.I enjoyed the historical aspect of this without seeing much chemistry between Madeline and Henry.I enjoyed the story itself and will likely read the other titles in the series.Thank you to Kensington Books / Zebra and NetGalley for the DRC!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love visiting the Worthington family. I enjoyed Madeline and Harry's story. I would recommend. Looking forward to Alice's story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Delightful Regency Romance
reviews.reviewText: I've only been reading Ella Quinn since January, but I love her books and so glad I tried them! This is another regency romance novel about the Worthington family. They are a truly delightful group. The storyline is simple yet moving. It takes Madeline a while to realize she is falling in love with Harry, so I found myself rooting for him, He is true hero material, and she is a worthy match for him. Don't miss this novel that will have you smiling at the antics of the entire family!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Harry woos Madeline
reviews.reviewText: I adore the characters that Ms Quinn creates and the stories she weaves with details of the period clothing, mores and the day to day life of the upper class and the lower ones. My one complaint is there are so many characters, many whom have several names and titles, that I couldn't keep them straight. A family tree would be very helpful.The Husband List happens concurrently to the Marriage List. You need to have read The Marriage List to understand what is happening with Eleanor. This book is about one of Eleanor's sister-in-laws, Madeline Vivers. Madeline, Eleanor and Alice, Eleanor's twin sister are all coming out this season. While the three of them made a list of qualities that they want in a husband in the last book, Madeline is being pressured by her mother, to look for a title. Fortunately, her brother is her guardian, and he wants all of his sister's to have love matches. Harry Stern is a barrister. He sees Madeline and it is love at first sight, but he needs to convince Madeline. He receives a lot of helpful suggestions from his many relatives and he is smart enough to listen. It is a charming story of Harry's wooing Madeline and then their setting up of their new household. Witty dialogue.I read an ARC from the publisher via NetGally.com and this is my unbiased and voluntary review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A great read for the cold winter nights.

The story is quite a lecture on how husbands or wifes were selected by women and men and their relatives, mainly with the help of specific lists, during the Regency era. Also included at great length and repeatedly mentioned were the formalities involved and adhered to, often causing serious troubles and tribulations. A mere mister wasn't as desireable as Dukes, Earls, or Barons, for instance, never mind how good-looking, smart, nice, or funny he might be. But some did marry for love, too, and, depending on their status, often became victims of nasty gossip among the 'ton', especially when a marriage turned out to be happy.Also included was lot's of text about the clothes, shoes, boots and hats people wore then and in what colors, and how often outfits needed to be changed during a day, and how many horses or carriages the upperclass deemed necessary to represent their status. No wonder so many servants were needed to manage it all successfully.I can recommend this story to all of those who have trouble falling asleep, since it worked better for me than camomile tea ever could!
